name: Nimiipuu Community Development Fund
address: Lapwai, ID (Specific address not publicly available, but serves Nez Perce Reservation and surrounding areas)
description: A certified Native Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) that provides business lending, consumer lending, and home improvement lending to tribal and non-tribal community members near the Nez Perce Reservation
services: American-Indian-owned Financing assistance in Idaho consultation

name: North Idaho Native Fund
address: Coeur d'Alene Reservation area (Specific address not publicly available)
description: An emerging CDFI providing technical support, business counseling, financial education, and financing options to the Coeur d'Alene Tribe and surrounding communities. They offer loan products such as debt consolidation and payday alternative loans
services: American-Indian-owned Financing assistance in Idaho consultation

name: Idaho Native American Women Business Alliance
address: Various locations through partnerships (e.g., Idaho Hispanic Foundation, Coeur d'Alene, Nez Perce, and Shoshone-Bannock tribes)
description: This alliance fosters relationships with Idaho Native American tribes and connects tribal women with statewide partners for business development, including workshops, training, and counseling services
services: American-Indian-owned Financing assistance in Idaho consultation

name: Shoshone-Bannock Tribes Economic Development
address: Fort Hall, ID (Specific address for financing assistance not detailed)
description: The Shoshone-Bannock Tribes are actively involved in economic development, aiming to create opportunities and foster prosperity for their members. They have developed comprehensive economic strategies and are involved in various projects
services: American-Indian-owned Financing assistance in Idaho consultation

name: Nez Perce Tribe Department of Planning and Economic Development
description: This department guides the Tribe's economic sustainability and growth, focusing on short- and long-term strategies to diversify and strengthen the tribal economy. They also support entrepreneurs within the Nez Perce community
services: American-Indian-owned Financing assistance in Idaho consultation

name: Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla Indian Reservation (CTUIR) Business Services
address: 46411 Timíne Way, Pendleton, OR 97801 (Serves communities in Idaho as well)
description: CTUIR offers business services through Nixyáawii Community Financial Services and has an economic and community development team that assists with business planning, development, and more
services: American-Indian-owned Financing assistance in Idaho consultation

name: Idaho Rez Rising
address: Online platform, no physical address listed for business operations
description: An initiative providing a platform to connect individuals with Native-owned businesses in Idaho. It aims to offer collaborative relationship building, small business training, and access to financing and capital
services: American-Indian-owned Financing assistance in Idaho consultation

name: U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) Office of Native American Affairs (ONAA)
description: ONAA facilitates access to business growth and expansion tools for Native American-owned small businesses, offering technical assistance, counseling, and information on SBA programs like the 8(a) Business Development Program
services: American-Indian-owned Financing assistance in Idaho consultation

name: Statewide CDC Native American Loan Fund
address: Specific location not detailed, but serves businesses looking for low-cost capital
description: This program offers SBA 504 loans specifically tailored to support Native American-owned businesses investing in fixed assets, such as real estate, machinery, and equipment
services: American-Indian-owned Financing assistance in Idaho consultation

name: Northwest Native Chamber
address: Various locations in Oregon, Washington, and Idaho
description: This organization works to advance educational and economic opportunities for Native people in Oregon, Washington, and Idaho, supporting Native communities in building lasting wealth through various programs and initiatives
